title: Appointment
description: A booking of a healthcare event among patient(s), practitioner(s), related person(s) and/or device(s) for a specific date/time. This may result in one or more Encounter(s).(Based on HL7 FHIR Release 5 specifications)

fhir:identifier.title: Identifier
fhir:identifier.description: This records identifiers associated with this appointment concern that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate.

fhir:status.title: Status
fhir:status.description: proposed | pending | booked | arrived | fulfilled | cancelled | noshow | entered-in-error | checked-in | waitlist.

fhir:cancellationReason.title: Cancellation Reason
fhir:cancellationReason.description: The coded reason for the appointment being cancelled. This is often used in reporting/billing/futher processing to determine if further actions are required, or specific fees apply.

fhir:class.title: Class
fhir:class.description: Concepts representing classification of patient encounter such as ambulatory (outpatient), inpatient, emergency, home health or others due to local variations.

fhir:serviceCategory.title: Service Category
fhir:serviceCategory.description: A broad categorization of the service that is to be performed during this appointment.

fhir:serviceType.title: Service Type
fhir:serviceType.description: The specific service that is to be performed during this appointment.

fhir:specialty.title: Specialty
fhir:specialty.description: The specialty of a practitioner that would be required to perform the service requested in this appointment.

fhir:appointmentType.title: Appointment Type
fhir:appointmentType.description: The style of appointment or patient that has been booked in the slot (not service type).

fhir:reason.title: Reason
fhir:reason.description: The reason that this appointment is being scheduled. This is more clinical than administrative. This can be coded, or as specified using information from another resource. When the patient arrives and the encounter begins it may be used as the admission diagnosis. The indication will typically be a Condition (with other resources referenced in the evidence.detail), or a Procedure.

fhir:priority.title: Priority
fhir:priority.description: The priority of the appointment. Can be used to make informed decisions if needing to re-prioritize appointments. (The iCal Standard specifies 0 as undefined, 1 as highest, 9 as lowest priority).

fhir:description.title: Description
fhir:description.description: The brief description of the appointment as would be shown on a subject line in a meeting request, or appointment list. Detailed or expanded information should be put in the note field.

fhir:replaces.title: Replaces
fhir:replaces.description: Appointment replaced by this Appointment in cases where there is a cancellation, the details of the cancellation can be found in the cancellationReason property (on the referenced resource).

fhir:virtualService.title: Virtual Service
fhir:virtualService.description: Connection details of a virtual service (e.g. conference call).

fhir:supportingInformation.title: Supporting Information
fhir:supportingInformation.description: Additional information to support the appointment provided when making the appointment.

fhir:previousAppointment.title: Previous Appointment
fhir:previousAppointment.description: The previous appointment in a series of related appointments.

fhir:originatingAppointment.title: Originating Appointment
fhir:originatingAppointment.description: The originating appointment in a recurring set of related appointments.

fhir:start.title: Start
fhir:start.description: Date/Time that the appointment is to take place.

fhir:end.title: End
fhir:end.description: Date/Time that the appointment is to conclude.

fhir:minutesDuration.title: Minutes Duration
fhir:minutesDuration.description: Number of minutes that the appointment is to take. This can be less than the duration between the start and end times. For example, where the actual time of appointment is only an estimate or if a 30 minute appointment is being requested, but any time would work. Also, if there is, for example, a planned 15 minute break in the middle of a long appointment, the duration may be 15 minutes less than the difference between the start and end.

fhir:requestedPeriod.title: Requested Period
fhir:requestedPeriod.description: A set of date ranges (potentially including times) that the appointment is preferred to be scheduled within.

fhir:slot.title: Slot
fhir:slot.description: The slots from the participants' schedules that will be filled by the appointment.

fhir:account.title: Account
fhir:account.description: The set of accounts that is expected to be used for billing the activities that result from this Appointment.

fhir:created.title: Created
fhir:created.description: The date that this appointment was initially created. This could be different to the meta.lastModified value on the initial entry, as this could have been before the resource was created on the FHIR server, and should remain unchanged over the lifespan of the appointment.

fhir:cancellationDate.title: Cancellation Date
fhir:cancellationDate.description: The date/time describing when the appointment was cancelled.

fhir:patientInstruction.title: Patient Instruction
fhir:patientInstruction.description: The diagnosis relevant to the appointment.

fhir:basedOn.title: Based On
fhir:basedOn.description: The request this appointment is allocated to assess (e.g. incoming referral or procedure request).

fhir:subject.title: Subject
fhir:subject.description: The patient or group associated with the appointment, if they are to be present (usually) then they should also be included in the participant backbone element.

fhir:participant.title: Participant
fhir:participant.description: List of participants involved in the appointment.

xdm:type.title: Type
xdm:type.description: Role of participant in the appointment.

xdm:actor.title: Actor
xdm:actor.description: The individual, device, location, or service participating in the appointment.

xdm:required.title: Required
xdm:required.description: Whether this participant is required to be present at the meeting. If false, the participant is optional.

fhir:recurrenceId.title: RecurrenceId
fhir:recurrenceId.description: The sequence number that identifies a specific appointment in a recurring pattern.

fhir:occurrenceChanged.title: Occurrence Changed
fhir:occurrenceChanged.description: This appointment varies from the recurring pattern.

fhir:recurrenceTemplate.title: Recurrence Template
fhir:recurrenceTemplate.description: The details of the recurrence pattern or template that is used to generate recurring appointments.

xdm:timezone.title: Timezone
xdm:timezone.description: The timezone of the recurring appointment occurrences.

xdm:recurrenceType.title: Recurrence Type
xdm:recurrenceType.description: How often the appointment series should recur.

xdm:lastOccurrenceDate.title: Last Occurrence Date
xdm:lastOccurrenceDate.description: Recurring appointments will not occur after this date.

xdm:occurrenceCount.title: Occurrence Count
xdm:occurrenceCount.description: How many appointments are planned in the recurrence.

xdm:occurrenceDate.title: Occurrence Date
xdm:occurrenceDate.description: The list of specific dates that will have appointments generated.

xdm:monday.title: Monday
xdm:monday.description: Indicates that recurring appointments should occur on Mondays.

xdm:tuesday.title: Tuesday
xdm:tuesday.description: Indicates that recurring appointments should occur on Tuesdays.

xdm:wednesday.title: Wednesday
xdm:wednesday.description: Indicates that recurring appointments should occur on Wednesdays.

xdm:thursday.title: Thursday
xdm:thursday.description: Indicates that recurring appointments should occur on Thursdays.

xdm:friday.title: friday
xdm:friday.description: Indicates that recurring appointments should occur on Fridays.

xdm:saturday.title: Saturday
xdm:saturday.description: Indicates that recurring appointments should occur on Saturdays.

xdm:sunday.title: Sunday
xdm:sunday.description: Indicates that recurring appointments should occur on Sundays.

xdm:weekInterval.title: Week Interval
xdm:weekInterval.description: The interval defines if the recurrence is every nth week. The default is every week, so it is expected that this value will be 2 or more.

xdm:dayOfMonth.title: Day Of Month
xdm:dayOfMonth.description: Indicates that appointments in the series of recurring appointments should occur on a specific day of the month.

xdm:nthWeekOfMonth.title: Nth Week Of Month
xdm:nthWeekOfMonth.description: Indicates that appointments in the series of recurring appointments should occur on a specific day of the month.

xdm:dayOfWeek.title: Day Of Week
xdm:dayOfWeek.description: Indicates that appointments in the series of recurring appointments should occur on a specific day of the month.

xdm:monthInterval.title: Month Interval
xdm:monthInterval.description: Indicates that recurring appointments should occur every nth month.

xdm:excludingDate.title: Excluding Date
xdm:excludingDate.description: Any dates, such as holidays, that should be excluded from the recurrence.

xdm:excludingRecurrenceId.title: Excluding Recurrence Id
xdm:excludingRecurrenceId.description: Any recurrence IDs that should be excluded from the recurrence.
